xccdf:Rule.xccdf:title: Auditing: Audit DROP ANY PROCEDURE

xccdf:rationale.xhtml:p: Audit the use of DROP ANY PROCEDURE.

ecl:SQL-query.ecl:query: select ROWNUM from DBA_STMT_AUDIT_OPTS where AUDIT_OPTION = 'DROP ANY PROCEDURE' and USER_NAME is null and PROXY_NAME is null and SUCCESS = 'BY ACCESS' and FAILURE = 'BY ACCESS'

xccdf:Rule.xccdf:title: Auditing: Audit DROP ANY TABLE

xccdf:rationale.xhtml:p: Audit the use of DROP ANY TABLE.

ecl:SQL-query.ecl:query: select ROWNUM from DBA_STMT_AUDIT_OPTS where AUDIT_OPTION = 'DROP ANY TABLE' and USER_NAME is null and PROXY_NAME is null and SUCCESS = 'BY ACCESS' and FAILURE = 'BY ACCESS'

xccdf:Rule.xccdf:title: Auditing: Audit GRANT ANY PRIVILEGE

xccdf:rationale.xhtml:p: Audit the use of GRANT ANY PRIVILEGE.

ecl:SQL-query.ecl:query: select ROWNUM from DBA_STMT_AUDIT_OPTS where AUDIT_OPTION = 'GRANT ANY PRIVILEGE' and USER_NAME is null and PROXY_NAME is null and SUCCESS = 'BY ACCESS' and FAILURE = 'BY ACCESS'

xccdf:Rule.xccdf:title: Auditing: Audit GRANT ANY ROLE

xccdf:rationale.xhtml:p: Audit the use of GRANT ANY ROLE.

ecl:SQL-query.ecl:query: select ROWNUM from DBA_STMT_AUDIT_OPTS where AUDIT_OPTION = 'GRANT ANY ROLE' and USER_NAME is null and PROXY_NAME is null and SUCCESS = 'BY ACCESS' and FAILURE = 'BY ACCESS'

xccdf:Rule.xccdf:title: Auditing: Audit INSERT failures

xccdf:rationale.xhtml:p: Audit INSERT failures attempted into critical data objects.

xccdf:Rule.xccdf:title: Auditing: Logon, logoff, database start or stop, and other information.

xccdf:description.xhtml:p: Logon, logoff, database start or stop, and other information.

xccdf:rationale.xhtml:p: Create triggers against all tables and system events that are meaningful to the database and application.

xccdf:Rule.xccdf:title: Auditing: Use triggers to implement row level auditing

xccdf:description.xhtml:p: Use triggers to implement row level auditing

xccdf:rationale.xhtml:p: Use triggers to enforce row level auditing for important data.

xccdf:Rule.xccdf:title: Auditing: Review procedures and reports to review audit logs

xccdf:description.xhtml:p: Review procedures and reports to review audit logs

xccdf:rationale.xhtml:p: Regular, timely reviews of the collected audit information must be done.

xccdf:Rule.xccdf:title: Auditing: Set AUDIT ALL ON SYS.AUD$ BY ACCESS

xccdf:description.xhtml:p: Set AUDIT ALL ON SYS.AUD$ BY ACCESS

xccdf:rationale.xhtml:p: By setting AUDIT ALL ON SYS.AUD$ BY ACCESS, attempts to alter the audit trail will be audited. Only applicable if the audit trail parameter is set to DB or TRUE.

ecl:SQL-query.ecl:query: select ROWNUM from DBA_OBJ_AUDIT_OPTS where OWNER = 'SYS' and OBJECT_NAME = 'AUD$' and ALT='A/A' and AUD='A/A' and COM='A/A' and DEL='A/A' and GRA='A/A' and IND='A/A' and INS='A/A' and LOC='A/A' and REN='A/A' and SEL='A/A' and UPD='A/A' and FBK='A/A'

xccdf:Rule.xccdf:title: Auditing: Regularly purge the audit trail

xccdf:rationale.xhtml:p: Review the purging procedures to ensure that the audit trail is purged regularly.

xccdf:Group.xccdf:title: Appendix A – Additional Settings (not scored)
xccdf:Group.xccdf:description: This secrion of items is not scored and serves as documentation of additional best practices to consideration for Oracle 10g and 9i.

xccdf:Rule.xccdf:title: Oracle Label Security: Where possible use Oracle Label Security.

xccdf:description.xhtml:p: Where possible use Oracle Label Security.

xccdf:rationale.xhtml:p: OLS is a strong additional layer of security (and can be implemented without significant Oracle experience.) Do we really want to say this? I would suggest:

OLS is a strong additional layer of security that can be used to create a Virtual Private database (VPD). OLS allows data of varying sensitivities to be stored in a single database and access to the data to be restricted using security clearances as defined by role level.

xccdf:Rule.xccdf:title: Oracle Label Security: Where possible, when using OLS, hide the label column.

xccdf:description.xhtml:p: Where possible, when using OLS, hide the label column.

This can be done by passing the “HIDE” directive to the “DEFAULT_OPTIONS” parameter of the “SA_SYSDBA.CREATE_POLICY” (globally) or to the “TABLE_OPTIONS” parameter of the “APPLY_TABLE_POLICY” proceedure (for a specific table).
Note: After applying a OLS policy to a table, the hidden status of the labels cannot be revoked without the loss of the labels.

xccdf:rationale.xhtml:p: If the status of the hidden label column needs to be changed, the values of the label column may be copied to an added column, then the hidden column can be removed, the column copied, then remove the policy dropping the row label column. Reinstate the policy and then copy the values from the added column to the row label column and then remove the added column.

xccdf:Rule.xccdf:title: Oracle Label Security: Include the LABEL_UPDATE as a value for table_options parameter when the OLS policy is applied to a table.

xccdf:description.xhtml:p: Include the LABEL_UPDATE as a value for table_options parameter when the OLS policy is applied to a table.

xccdf:rationale.xhtml:p: This ensures the user cannot reclassify the data in the record by changing the label.

xccdf:Rule.xccdf:title: Oracle Label Security: Where possible, use a trusted procedure to limit and control the manipulation of the labels.

xccdf:description.xhtml:p: Where possible, use a trusted procedure to limit and control the manipulation of the labels.

xccdf:rationale.xhtml:p: By the creation of a procedure, direct manipulation by database users of the labels is prevented and an additional level of security is provided. This can provide a separation of responsibility between the DBA and the security administrators.

xccdf:Rule.xccdf:title: Oracle Label Security: Have a secure and separate data copy before implementing OLS.

xccdf:description.xhtml:p: Have a secure and separate data copy before implementing OLS.

xccdf:rationale.xhtml:p: OLS introduces an additional hidden column into a table. For some tables the addition of a column or a hidden column may render the table unusable. For applications that expect to see all the data, OLS may be interpreted as corrupt data.

xccdf:Rule.xccdf:title: Oracle Label Security: Where applicable and possible, store labels in the Oracle Internet Directory (OID).

xccdf:description.xhtml:p: Where applicable and possible, store labels in the Oracle Internet Directory (OID).

xccdf:rationale.xhtml:p: In the context of Enterprise User Security option this provides a centralized management method for user passwords, enterprise roles, and OLS authorization. Under the control of the OID, policies cannot be manipulated within the databases.

xccdf:Rule.xccdf:title: RAID file systems: Implement

xccdf:rationale.xhtml:p: File systems holding the Oracle data should be on RAID volumes for resilience.

xccdf:Rule.xccdf:title: Magnetically wipe failed disks: Implement

xccdf:rationale.xhtml:p: Magnetically wipe old, no longer used, or failed disks. This issue is most likely handled by system administrators.

xccdf:Rule.xccdf:title: Backups on system disks: Verify permissions
